Class TwoDimRaggedArrayUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • TwoDimRaggedArrayUtility

  • public class TwoDimRaggedArrayUtility
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a two-dimensional ragged array. It contains a method for reading string representations of numerical values from a txt file, converting them to doubles, and storing in a two-dimensional array of doubles as well as a method for writing an array of doubles to a txt file. The remaining methods return information based on the two-dimensional array, such as the highest value of a particular column or row.
    Author:
    hudson

      TwoDimRaggedArrayUtility()
      No-arg constructor that accepts no parameters/arguments.

      static double[][] readFile(java.io.File file)
      This method reads string representations of numerical values from a txt file, converts them to double values, and stores them in a two-dimensional array of doubles by reading each line of the txt file until the txt file has no input left to read from.
      static void writeToFile(double[][] data, java.io.File outputFile)
      This method writes an array of doubles to a txt file by iterating through each row and column of the two-dimensional array.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TwoDimRaggedArrayUtility

        public TwoDimRaggedArrayUtility()
        No-arg constructor that accepts no parameters/arguments.

    • Method Detail

      • readFile

        public static double[][] readFile(java.io.File file)
                           throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This method reads string representations of numerical values from a txt file, converts them to double values, and stores them in a two-dimensional array of doubles by reading each line of the txt file until the txt file has no input left to read from.
        Parameters:
        file - The txt file from which data is read.
        Returns:
        The two-dimensional ragged array of doubles created by reading the txt file.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • writeToFile

        public static void writeToFile(double[][] data,
                               java.io.File outputFile)
                        throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This method writes an array of doubles to a txt file by iterating through each row and column of the two-dimensional array.
        Parameters:
        data - The array of doubles to written to the txt file.
        outputFile - The txt file to which the array of doubles should be written.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • getColumnTotal

        public static double getColumnTotal(double[][] data,
                                    int col)
        This method returns the total of a specific column in a two-dimensional ragged array by accepting a column index, col, and a two-dimensional array, data, as parameters. If a row in the two-dimensional array doesn't have this column index, the row is not included in this method.
        Parameters:
        data - The two-dimensional ragged array.
        col - The column index of the two-dimensional array whose row values are to be summed.
        Returns:
        The total of all elements in the column index, col.

      • getHighestInColumn

        public static double getHighestInColumn(double[][] data,
                                        int col)
        This method returns the highest value of a specific column in a two-dimensional ragged array by accepting a column index, col, and a two-dimensional array, data, as parameters. If a row in the two-dimensional array doesn't have this column index, the row is not included in this method.
        Parameters:
        data - The two-dimensional ragged array.
        col - The column index of the two-dimensional array.
        Returns:
        The largest value in the column index, col.

If a row in the two-dimensional array doesn't have this column index, the row is not included in this method.
        Parameters:

      • getAverage

        public static double getAverage(double[][] data)
        This method returns the average value of a two-dimensional ragged array, data, passed as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        data - The two-dimensional ragged array.
        Returns:
        The total value of all elements divided by the number of elements in the two-dimensional ragged array, data.
